sap.collaboration.components.socialtimel.constructorDescription:
Constructor for the Social Timeline Component. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableSocial enableSocial} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAlignment alignment} : sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAlignment (default: Right)
    • {@link #getAxisOrientation axisOrientation} : sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAxisOrientation (default: Vertical)
    • {@link #getNoDataText noDataText} : string
    • {@link #getShowIcons showIcons} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '100%')
    • {@link #getCustomFilter customFilter} : object[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:customActionPress customActionPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.
sap.collaboration.components.socialtimel.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.34.0 For new integrations and existing implementations running on release 1.32 or later, use the Group Feed component (sap.collaboration.components.feed.Component), Business Object mode(sap.collaboration.FeedType.BusinessObjectGroups). Note that the Group Feed component does not display any updates related to the business object from the back-end system (system updates).
Social Timeline

DeprecatedInfo.description: For new integrations and existing implementations running on release 1.32 or later, use the Group Feed component (sap.collaboration.components.feed.Component), Business Object mode(sap.collaboration.FeedType.BusinessObjectGroups). Note that the Group Feed component does not display any updates related to the business object from the back-end system (system updates).

sap.collaboration.components.fiori.feed..description:
Feed Component
A Feed Component is a ui5 component that applications can use to render a sap.m.App that embeds the JAM Feed Widget.
The Component class extends the base UI5 UIComponent class.
This class defines the Reusable UI5 Component structure, i.e properties, aggregations and events, if any, and creates the UI5 controls to be displayed.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.feed..constructorDescription:
Constructor for the Feed Component. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "")
    • {@link #getODataServiceUrl oDataServiceUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/SM_INTEGRATION_SRV")
    • {@link #getFeedType feedType} : string
    • {@link #getGroupIds groupIds} : string
    • {@link #getObject object} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.feed..helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.26.0 Please use sap.collaboration.components.fiori.feed.dialog.Component instead.
Feed Component
A Feed Component is a ui5 component that applications can use to render a sap.m.App that embeds the JAM Feed Widget.
The Component class extends the base UI5 UIComponent class.
This class defines the Reusable UI5 Component structure, i.e properties, aggregations and events, if any, and creates the UI5 controls to be displayed.

rootControl.description:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.
rootControl.helpDescription:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

feedType.description: The type of feed to be displayed. The available types are in @link sap.collaboration.FeedType.
feedType.helpDescription: The type of feed to be displayed. The available types are in @link sap.collaboration.FeedType.

groupIds.description: A comma separated list of the IDs of the groups to display in the widget.
groupIds.helpDescription: A comma separated list of the IDs of the groups to display in the widget.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

oDataServiceUrl.description: The OData service URL needed for the Feed Component.
oDataServiceUrl.helpDescription: The OData service URL needed for the Feed Component.

object.description:
A JSON object passed to the Feed component. It is required when the value of feedType is sap.collaboration.FeedType.object or sap.collaboration.FeedType.objectGroup. This object represents business related information, such as a sales order, an opportunity, etc. It contains the following properties:
  • id: The Business Object ID to be posted in the SAP Jam Feed. It needs to be an OData URL containing the relative path to the object in the back-end.
  • type: The type of the Business Object. It needs to be the OData meta data URL to the corresponding Entity Collection.
  • name? (optional): The description of the Business Object to be displayed in SAP Jam, i.e. "SO 57746", "Opportunity 123", etc.
  • ui_url? (optional): The URL to navigate to the same Business Object in the application.
object.helpDescription:
A JSON object passed to the Feed component. It is required when the value of feedType is sap.collaboration.FeedType.object or sap.collaboration.FeedType.objectGroup. This object represents business related information, such as a sales order, an opportunity, etc. It contains the following properties:
  • id: The Business Object ID to be posted in the SAP Jam Feed. It needs to be an OData URL containing the relative path to the object in the back-end.
  • type: The type of the Business Object. It needs to be the OData meta data URL to the corresponding Entity Collection.
  • name? (optional): The description of the Business Object to be displayed in SAP Jam, i.e. "SO 57746", "Opportunity 123", etc.
  • ui_url? (optional): The URL to navigate to the same Business Object in the application.

sap.collaboration.components.feed.Compon.description: The Feed Component is an SAPUI5 component that allows you to display SAP Jam feeds. It includes the option to add new posts and reply to entries and view other users' social profiles from SAP Jam.
sap.collaboration.components.feed.Compon.constructorDescription:
Constructor for the Feed Component. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAxisOrientation axisOrientation} : sap.suite.ui.commons.TimelineAxisOrientation (default: Vertical)
    • {@link #getFeedSources feedSources} : object|Array.
    • {@link #getEnableScroll enableScroll} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.
sap.collaboration.components.feed.Compon.helpDescription: The Feed Component is an SAPUI5 component that allows you to display SAP Jam feeds. It includes the option to add new posts and reply to entries and view other users' social profiles from SAP Jam.

sap.collaboration.components.fiori.shari.description: The Share Dialog component is an SAPUI5 component that you can use to create a dialog in your application to enable you to enter or edit information shared to SAP Jam.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.shari.constructorDescription:
Constructor for the share dialog component Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAttachments attachments} : object
    • {@link #getObject object} : object
    • {@link #getExternalObject externalObject} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.shari.helpDescription: The Share Dialog component is an SAPUI5 component that you can use to create a dialog in your application to enable you to enter or edit information shared to SAP Jam.

rootControl.description:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.
rootControl.helpDescription:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

attachments.description:
When you want to provide the user with the option to share file attachments, then the following properties need to be specified:
  • attachmentsArray: An array of {@link sap.collaboration.components.fiori.sharing.attachment.Attachment} objects. This array offers users a list of files they can attach.
attachments.helpDescription:
When you want to provide the user with the option to share file attachments, then the following properties need to be specified:
  • attachmentsArray: An array of {@link sap.collaboration.components.fiori.sharing.attachment.Attachment} objects. This array offers users a list of files they can attach.

externalObject.description:
A Business Object such as an Opportunity, Sales Order, Account, etc. from the back-end that will be shared as a Featured External Object in a Group in Jam.
  • {string} appContext: The application context. Example: "CRM", "SD", etc.
  • {string} odataServicePath: The relative path to the OData Service. Example: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/ODATA_SRV"
  • {string} collection: The name of the OData Collection. Example: "Account", "Opportunity", etc.
  • {string} key: The key to identify a particular instance of the Business Object. It can be a simple ID or a compound key. Example: "123", "ObjectID='123'", "ObjectID='123',ObjectType='BUS000123'", etc.
  • {string} name: The short name of the Business Object. Example: "Sales Order 123", "Opportunity 123", "Account 123", etc.
 These attributes are not enforced by the UI (missing or incorrect values are not validated), but they are required to make the integration work. These attributes also should be mapped in the Back-end System and Jam in order to make the External Object work.
Note: the externalObject is dependent on object.id, therefore, the object.id must also be passed to the Share Component. See the parameter "object" for more information.
externalObject.helpDescription:
A Business Object such as an Opportunity, Sales Order, Account, etc. from the back-end that will be shared as a Featured External Object in a Group in Jam.
  • {string} appContext: The application context. Example: "CRM", "SD", etc.
  • {string} odataServicePath: The relative path to the OData Service. Example: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/ODATA_SRV"
  • {string} collection: The name of the OData Collection. Example: "Account", "Opportunity", etc.
  • {string} key: The key to identify a particular instance of the Business Object. It can be a simple ID or a compound key. Example: "123", "ObjectID='123'", "ObjectID='123',ObjectType='BUS000123'", etc.
  • {string} name: The short name of the Business Object. Example: "Sales Order 123", "Opportunity 123", "Account 123", etc.
 These attributes are not enforced by the UI (missing or incorrect values are not validated), but they are required to make the integration work. These attributes also should be mapped in the Back-end System and Jam in order to make the External Object work.
Note: the externalObject is dependent on object.id, therefore, the object.id must also be passed to the Share Component. See the parameter "object" for more information.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

object.description:
A JSON object passed to the share component. This object contains the following properties:
  • id (optional): is the object Id to be shared in SAP Jam, i.e a URL( or a callback function that returns a URL) that navigates back to the same object in the application
  • display (optional): is a UI5 control to be displayed in the component UI
    Note: The preferred object to pass in the display parameter is sap.m.ObjectListItem. Using other type of objects (for example: ap.ui.commons.TextView) may result in problems in the rendering of the content which needs to be corrected by the application owners.
  • share (optional): is a note that will be displayed in the component UI and shared to SAP Jam too
object.helpDescription:
A JSON object passed to the share component. This object contains the following properties:
  • id (optional): is the object Id to be shared in SAP Jam, i.e a URL( or a callback function that returns a URL) that navigates back to the same object in the application
  • display (optional): is a UI5 control to be displayed in the component UI
    Note: The preferred object to pass in the display parameter is sap.m.ObjectListItem. Using other type of objects (for example: ap.ui.commons.TextView) may result in problems in the rendering of the content which needs to be corrected by the application owners.
  • share (optional): is a note that will be displayed in the component UI and shared to SAP Jam too

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

Constructor for the Social Profile Component. !!! EXPERIMENTAL !!! Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPlacement placement} : sap.m.PlacementType (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getMemberId memberId} : string
    • {@link #getMemberInfo memberInfo} : object
    • {@link #getOpeningControl openingControl} : object
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "380px")
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "300px")
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.

sap.collaboration.components.fiori.notif.description:
Notification Component

A Notification Component is a UI5 component that displays a SAP Jam member's latest notifications.

This component refreshes itself when the number of seconds specified in the <tt>refreshInterval</tt> parameter elapses. When refreshing, the backend is called to obtain the latest notifications.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.notif.constructorDescription:
Constructor for the notification component. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getODataServiceUrl oDataServiceUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/SM_INTEGRATION_SRV")
    • {@link #getNumberOfNotifications numberOfNotifications} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getTransitionInterval transitionInterval} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getRefreshInterval refreshInterval} : int (default: 300)
    • {@link #getNotificationsTargetUrl notificationsTargetUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.notif.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.26.0 There is no replacement for this control. The Fiori Launchpad now provides its own implementation for this control. This control was never meant to be used directly by third parties.
Notification Component A Notification Component is a UI5 component that displays a SAP Jam member's latest notifications. This component refreshes itself when the number of seconds specified in the refreshInterval parameter elapses. When refreshing, the backend is called to obtain the latest notifications.

DeprecatedInfo.description: There is no replacement for this control. The Fiori Launchpad now provides its own implementation for this control. This control was never meant to be used directly by third parties.

rootControl.description:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.
rootControl.helpDescription:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

refreshInterval.description: The time in seconds before calling the backend to update the notifications.
refreshInterval.helpDescription: The time in seconds before calling the backend to update the notifications.

notificationsTargetUrl.description: When a user clicks on the component, a new browser tab will open at this URL.
notificationsTargetUrl.helpDescription: When a user clicks on the component, a new browser tab will open at this URL.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

transitionInterval.description: The time in seconds a notification is displayed before the next notification is displayed.
transitionInterval.helpDescription: The time in seconds a notification is displayed before the next notification is displayed.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

oDataServiceUrl.description: The OData service URL needed for the notification component.
oDataServiceUrl.helpDescription: The OData service URL needed for the notification component.

numberOfNotifications.description: The maximum number of notifications to be displayed.
numberOfNotifications.helpDescription: The maximum number of notifications to be displayed.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

This constructor must be called in the following way:

name, mimeType, and url are only place holders and can be any string.

sap.collaboration.components.fiori.feed..description:
Feed Dialog Component

A Feed Dialog Component is a ui5 component that applications can use to render the feed widget view in a dialog in order to discuss information in SAP JAM by adding and replying to feed posts related to a specific Business Object.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.feed..constructorDescription:
Constructor for the Feed Dialog Component. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "575px")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "605px")
    • {@link #getFeedType feedType} : string (default: FeedType.object)
    • {@link #getGroupIds groupIds} : string
    • {@link #getObject object} : object
    • {@link #getBusinessObject businessObject} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.feed..helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.34.0 For new integrations and existing implementations running on release 1.32 or later, use the Group Feed component (sap.collaboration.components.feed.Component), Business Object mode(sap.collaboration.FeedType.BusinessObjectGroups). Note that the Group Feed component does not display the full public feed for the object in SAP Jam (object wall), but rather is restricted to the feed for the object within a specific group (group object wall).
Feed Dialog Component A Feed Dialog Component is a ui5 component that applications can use to render the feed widget view in a dialog in order to discuss information in SAP JAM by adding and replying to feed posts related to a specific Business Object.

DeprecatedInfo.description: For new integrations and existing implementations running on release 1.32 or later, use the Group Feed component (sap.collaboration.components.feed.Component), Business Object mode(sap.collaboration.FeedType.BusinessObjectGroups). Note that the Group Feed component does not display the full public feed for the object in SAP Jam (object wall), but rather is restricted to the feed for the object within a specific group (group object wall).

rootControl.description:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.
rootControl.helpDescription:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

businessObject.description:
A JSON object passed to the Feed Dialog Component. This object represents business related information, such as a sales order, an opportunity, etc. It contains the following properties:
  • {string} appContext: The application context. Example: "CRM", "CB", "SD", etc.
  • {string} odataServicePath: The path to the OData Service and the Service name. Example: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/APPLICATION_SRV".
  • {string} collection: The name of the OData Collection. Example: "Account", "Opportunity", etc.
  • {string} key: The key to identify a particular instance of the Business Object. It can be a simple ID or a compound key. Example: "123", "ObjectID='123'", "ObjectID='123',ObjectType='BUS000123'", etc.
  • {string} name: The short name of the Business Object. Example: "Sales Order 123", "Opportunity 123", "Account 123", etc.
  • {string} ui_url: The URL to navigate to the same business object in the application.
businessObject.helpDescription:
A JSON object passed to the Feed Dialog Component. This object represents business related information, such as a sales order, an opportunity, etc. It contains the following properties:
  • {string} appContext: The application context. Example: "CRM", "CB", "SD", etc.
  • {string} odataServicePath: The path to the OData Service and the Service name. Example: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/APPLICATION_SRV".
  • {string} collection: The name of the OData Collection. Example: "Account", "Opportunity", etc.
  • {string} key: The key to identify a particular instance of the Business Object. It can be a simple ID or a compound key. Example: "123", "ObjectID='123'", "ObjectID='123',ObjectType='BUS000123'", etc.
  • {string} name: The short name of the Business Object. Example: "Sales Order 123", "Opportunity 123", "Account 123", etc.
  • {string} ui_url: The URL to navigate to the same business object in the application.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

feedType.description: [DEPRECATED] The type of feed to be displayed. The available types are in @link sap.collaboration.FeedType.
feedType.helpDescription: [DEPRECATED] The type of feed to be displayed. The available types are in @link sap.collaboration.FeedType.

groupIds.description: [DEPRECATED] The IDs of the group to display in the widget.
groupIds.helpDescription: [DEPRECATED] The IDs of the group to display in the widget.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

height.description:
The height of the component.

We need to pass a value in pixels, otherwise the dialog won't render correctly
height.helpDescription:
The height of the component.

We need to pass a value in pixels, otherwise the dialog won't render correctly

object.description:
[DEPRECATED] A JSON object passed to the Feed Dialog Component. Use businessObject instead. This object represents business related information, such as a sales order, an opportunity, etc. It contains the following properties:
  • id: The Business Object ID to be posted in the SAP Jam Feed. It needs to be an OData URL containing the relative path to the object in the back-end.
  • type: the type of the business object. It can be any text or it can be the OData meta data URL to the object Entity Type.
  • name (optional): the description of the business object to be displayed in SAP Jam, i.e. "SO 57746", "Opportunity 123", etc.
  • ui_url (optional): the URL to navigate to the same business object in the application.
Note: The object is passed by reference, which means that the attributes will be modified in the original object, for example, when the URLs contained in the id and type attributes are mapped (via OData call).
object.helpDescription:
[DEPRECATED] A JSON object passed to the Feed Dialog Component. Use businessObject instead. This object represents business related information, such as a sales order, an opportunity, etc. It contains the following properties:
  • id: The Business Object ID to be posted in the SAP Jam Feed. It needs to be an OData URL containing the relative path to the object in the back-end.
  • type: the type of the business object. It can be any text or it can be the OData meta data URL to the object Entity Type.
  • name (optional): the description of the business object to be displayed in SAP Jam, i.e. "SO 57746", "Opportunity 123", etc.
  • ui_url (optional): the URL to navigate to the same business object in the application.
Note: The object is passed by reference, which means that the attributes will be modified in the original object, for example, when the URLs contained in the id and type attributes are mapped (via OData call).

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

sap.collaboration.components.fiori.shari.description:
Share Component

A Share Component is a ui5 component that applications can use to share information to SAP Jam
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.shari.constructorDescription:
Constructor for the share component Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getODataServiceUrl oDataServiceUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/SM_INTEGRATION_V2_SRV")
    • {@link #getCollaborationHostODataServiceUrl collaborationHostODataServiceUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: "/sap/bc/ui2/smi/rest_tunnel/Jam/api/v1/OData")
    • {@link #getTunnelServiceUrl tunnelServiceUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: "/sap/bc/z_sail_httproxy/Jam/api/v1/OData")
    • {@link #getObject object} : object
    • {@link #getAttachments attachments} : object
    • {@link #getExternalObject externalObject} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.UIComponent} can be used as well.
sap.collaboration.components.fiori.shari.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.26.0 Please use sap.collaboration.components.fiori.sharing.dialog.Component instead.
Share Component A Share Component is a ui5 component that applications can use to share information to SAP Jam

rootControl.description:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.
rootControl.helpDescription:
The root control of the UIComponent.

The root control should be created inside the function {@link sap.ui.core.UIComponent#createContent}.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

oDataServiceUrl.description: The OData service URL needed for the share component.
oDataServiceUrl.helpDescription: The OData service URL needed for the share component.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

externalObject.description:
A Business Object such as an Opportunity, Sales Order, Account, etc. from the back-end that will be shared as a Featured External Object in a Group in Jam.
  • {string} appContext: The application context. Example: "CRM", "SD", etc.
  • {string} odataServicePath: The relative path to the OData Service. Example: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/ODATA_SRV"
  • {string} collection: The name of the OData Collection. Example: "Account", "Opportunity", etc.
  • {string} key: The key to identify a particular instance of the Business Object. It can be a simple ID or a compound key. Example: "123", "ObjectID='123'", "ObjectID='123',ObjectType='BUS000123'", etc.
  • {string} name: The short name of the Business Object. Example: "Sales Order 123", "Opportunity 123", "Account 123", etc.
 These attributes are not enforced by the UI (missing or incorrect values are not validated), but they are required to make the integration work. These attributes also should be mapped in the Back-end System and Jam in order to make the External Object work.
Note: the externalObject is dependent on object.id, therefore, the object.id must also be passed to the Share Component. See the parameter "object" for more information.
externalObject.helpDescription:
A Business Object such as an Opportunity, Sales Order, Account, etc. from the back-end that will be shared as a Featured External Object in a Group in Jam.
  • {string} appContext: The application context. Example: "CRM", "SD", etc.
  • {string} odataServicePath: The relative path to the OData Service. Example: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/ODATA_SRV"
  • {string} collection: The name of the OData Collection. Example: "Account", "Opportunity", etc.
  • {string} key: The key to identify a particular instance of the Business Object. It can be a simple ID or a compound key. Example: "123", "ObjectID='123'", "ObjectID='123',ObjectType='BUS000123'", etc.
  • {string} name: The short name of the Business Object. Example: "Sales Order 123", "Opportunity 123", "Account 123", etc.
 These attributes are not enforced by the UI (missing or incorrect values are not validated), but they are required to make the integration work. These attributes also should be mapped in the Back-end System and Jam in order to make the External Object work.
Note: the externalObject is dependent on object.id, therefore, the object.id must also be passed to the Share Component. See the parameter "object" for more information.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

object.description:
A JSON object passed to the share component. This object contains the following properties:
  • id (optional): is the object Id to be shared in SAP Jam, i.e a URL that navigates back to the same object in the application
  • display (optional): is a UI5 control to be displayed in the component UI
  • share (optional): is a note that will be displayed in the component UI and shared to SAP Jam too
object.helpDescription:
A JSON object passed to the share component. This object contains the following properties:
  • id (optional): is the object Id to be shared in SAP Jam, i.e a URL that navigates back to the same object in the application
  • display (optional): is a UI5 control to be displayed in the component UI
  • share (optional): is a note that will be displayed in the component UI and shared to SAP Jam too

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

customActionPress.name: customActionPress
customActionPress.description: Event fire when a custom action is clicked
customActionPress.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.name: parseError
parseError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.name: validationSuccess
validationSuccess.description: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.helpDescription: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationError.name: validationError
validationError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
